music_usage.2: - **加入YouTube或SoundCloud的歌曲到播放清單** 使用`~>play` 範例: `~>play https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aAolFWjGfMs` *我會自動連接到你所在的語音頻道*
music_usage.3: - **搜尋YouTube上的歌曲** 使用 `~>play <關鍵詞>` (不包含<>) 範例: `~>play see you again` (然後你需要選擇歌曲號碼，只要在選擇結果出現後*輸入那個號碼*就好了!)
music_usage.4: - **搜尋SoundCloud上的歌曲** 使用 `~>play soundcloud <關鍵詞>` 範例: `~>play soundcloud 鄧麗君`
music_usage.6: - **從播放清單中移除歌曲** 使用 `~>removetrack` 加上歌曲的排序序號 (使用~>queue來檢查)
music_usage.10: - 最後 **重複播放某首歌曲** 使用 `~>repeat`，**重複播放目前清單** 使用 `~>repeat queue`。在重複播放開啟的時後使用 `~>repeat` 來關閉它
music_usage.11: 要取得更多資訊請使用 `~>help <指令名稱>` (不包含<>)
music_usage.12: 謝謝使用Mantaro，享受你的音樂吧!

lang.info:
%1$s你可以更改綁定到這個伺服器的語言 (如果適合的話) 使用 `~>opts language set <語言代碼>`，或是使用 `~>profile lang <語言代碼>` 來改變你的偏好語言。
**可用語言:** `%2$s`
如果我沒有你想要的語言，歡迎加入我們的翻譯團隊並參與翻譯工作!

season.info:
*賽季/季節*是時間長度，通常為6個月，在此期間，玩家能夠爭奪金錢或聲譽排行榜的前10名。 得獎者將根據其季節性表現獲得徽章和獎品。
這是為了創造更具競爭力的整體感受，並使遊戲更加有趣 (金錢在之前是非常無用的)
您可以使用`-season`訪問具季節性的東西。profile/mine/fish/balance 等指令將需要它，而 loot/daily/reputation(聲望) 及各種小遊戲將對你的全局和季節性角色都產生效果。
season.info_2:
目前賽季是**%1$s**，且已經有**%2$s**個玩家在參與了!

有趣的來了，記得檢查`~>leaderboard money -season` `~>leaderboard rep -season` 和 `~>leaderboard games -season`
開始遊戲吧! <3
感謝使用Mantaro。

ls.description:
**This shows all of the custom (user-made) commands of this server.** Every command here is not associated with the bot itself in any shape or form.

Custom commands are commands created by users (usually server admins) which can handle a bunch of different situations, going as far as emulating action commands.
For more information on how to make custom commands refer to [this wiki page.](https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Custom-Commands)
 
**List:**
ls.footer: Total custom commands on this server: %1$s

custom.invalid: %1$sInvalid command selection. Check command help (`help custom`).

view.invalid: %1$sYou need to specify the command and the response number!
view.not_found: %1$sThere isn't a custom command with that name here.
view.less_than_specified: %1$sThis command has less responses than the number you specified...

raw.no_command: %1$sYou need to tell me what command you want to look at.
raw.description: This is a list of all the responses of this command on a raw format (what you input into the command).

make.start_text:
%1$sStarted **"Creation of Custom Command `%2$s`"**!
Send `&~>stop` to stop creation **without saving**.
Send `&~>save` to stop creation an **save the new Command**. Send any text beginning with `&` to be added to the Command Responses. Use `~>nsfw` to mark this command as NSFW and `~>sfw` to revert.
This Interactive Operation ends without saving after 60 seconds of inactivity.
make.no_responses_added: %1$sNo responses were added. Stopping creation without saving...
make.no_name_specified: %1$sYou didn't specify the name of the custom command to create!

eval.not_specified: You didn't specify anything to eval.
eval.new_error:
%1$sThere was an error while evaluating this custom command.
**Error**:
```%2$s```
eval.error:
%1$sThere was an error while evaluating this custom command!
%2$s

import.not_found: %1$sThere are no custom commands matching your search query.
import.note: (You can only select custom commands from guilds that you are a member of)
import.success: Imported custom command `%1$s` from guild `%2$s` with a total of %3$d responses.

deleteresponse.invalid_number: %1$sYou need to specify a correct number to change.
deleteresponse.not_enough_args: %1$sYou need to specify the command and the index you want to delete.

add.too_many_commands: %1%sThere are too many commands on this server, so you can't add more (+100). This can be bypassed by premium guilds (Check <https://patreon.com/mantaro>).

custom.no_cc: %1$sThere's no Custom Commands registered in this Guild, just a bit of dust.
custom.admin_only:
This guild only accepts custom command creation, edits, imports and eval from administrators.
**This is now the DEFAULT setting.**
- If you want to let everyone do this, and are an admin (Bot Commander role or Manage Server permission), run `~>opts admincustom false`

custom.invalid_string: %1$sThe string `{%2$s}` isn't valid, or the output is longer than 2000 characters.

optout.notice: %1$sYou've opted out of the entire waifu system, so you can't use this.
optout.warning:
%1$sDo you want to opt-out from the waifu system? THIS IS PERMANENT AND CAN'T BE REVERTED. 
If you only want to be opted out of new claims and wanna use the waifu system as usual, please use `~>profile claimlock` instead.
You won't be able to claim or be claimed, and all the claims over you will be removed.
Type `yes` or `no`. Typing yes will opt you out, no will cancel it.

waifu.description_header:
Here's a list with all of your beloved waifus, sorted by addition date.

If you wish to check your waifu stats, use `~>waifu stats`

ls.desc:
This is a list of the items you can cast using `~>cast`.
You can use full name or the short name (example: `~>cast "diamond pickaxe"`, or `~>cast "diamond p"`, works)
**Casting has a minimum cost of half the price of the item. The casting price will be shown down below.**.
Wrench tier 2 and 3 are comet and sparkle, respectively.

cast.dust: %1$sYou cannot cast with such a dusty inventory! *(Dust level: %2$s%%)*. Why not clean it up using `~>useitem mop`?
cast.wrench_multiple_use: Tip: *You can't use the wrench you are trying to cast with as ingredient!*

dump.no_item: %1$sYou need to specify the amount of that item (if it's only one, you don't need to specify the amount) and the item that you want to dump.
dump.invalid: %1$sNot a valid number of items to dump.

dump.more_items_than_player: %1$sYou cannot dump more items than what you have.

price.no_price: %1$sThis item is not available neither for sell or buy (could be an exclusive collectible)
price.collectible: %1$sThis is a collectible item. (Sell value: %2$,d credits)
price.success: %1$sThe market value of %2$s**%3$s** is %4$s credits to buy it and you can get %5$s credits if you sell it.

all.confirmation: %1$sAre you *sure* you want to sell **all** of your items? This will clear your *whole* inventory. If you wanna sell individual items please use the amount. Type *yes* to confirm and *no* to cancel

sell.non_existent: %1$sYou cannot sell a non-existent item. If you're lost, you can try typing the short name or wrapping the name in quotes.
sell.no_sell_price: %1$sYou cannot sell an item that cannot be sold. (But you can `~>market dump` it)
sell.no_item_player: %1$sYou cannot sell an item you don't have.
sell.more_items_than_player: %1$sYou cannot sell more items than what you have.

buy.no_item_amount: %1$sYou need to specify the amount of that item (if it's only one, you don't need to specify the amount) and the item that you want to buy.
buy.invalid: %1$sNot a valid number of items to buy.
buy.non_existent: %1$sYou cannot buy an non-existent item. If you're lost, you can try typing the short name or wrapping the name in quotes.

buy.item_limit_reached: %1$sYou cannot buy more of that object.
buy.success: %1$sBought %2$,d %3$s for %4$,d credits successfully. You now have %5$,d credits.
buy.not_enough_money: %1$sYou don't have enough money to buy this item.

market.reference: You can buy and sell items using `~>market buy <item>` and `~>market sell <item>`. Check `~>help market` for more info.

ls.desc: This is a list of all interactive items in Mantaro. For more info about interactive items check the wiki!

opts.note:
%1$sHey, if you're lost or want help on using opts, check <https://github.com/Mantaro/MantaroBot/wiki/Configuration> for a guide on how to use opts.
Note: Only administrators, people with Manage Server or people with the Bot Commander role can use this command!

list.header:
**Mantaro's Options List**
%1$s*All options must be prefixed with `~>opts` when running them*
%2$s

8ball.no_args: %1$sYou need to specify what you want the 8ball to answer.
8ball.error: %1$sI ran into an error while fetching the 8ball results.

list.name: Auto-role name:
list.no_autoroles: There aren't any autoroles setup in this server.
list.description: This are the current user-assignable auto roles on this server. You can use these by doing `~>iam <name of the role>`.

iam.deleted_role: %1$sThe role that this autorole corresponded to has been deleted
iam.error: %1$sI couldn't take from you **%2$s. Make sure that I have permission to add roles and that my role is above **%2$s**
iam.no_role: %1$sThere isn't an autorole with the name `%2$s`.
iam.no_iam: %1$sYou need to specify which auto-assignable role you want to assign yourself!

iamnot.no_args: %1$sYou have to specify what role you want me to remove from you, silly.

misc.reverse_missing: %1$sYou didn't provide any message to reverse.

poll.missing:
%1$sYou didn't include either the %2$s argument or it was empty!
%3$s
poll.invalid:
%1$sThis poll cannot build. **Remember that the options must be a maximum of 9 and a minimum of 2 and the timeout must be a maximum of 45m and a minimum of 30s.**
Options are separated with a comma, for example `1,2,3` (no spaces between them!). For spaced stuff use quotation marks at the start and end of the sentence. If you're really lost, there's an example on `~>help poll`
poll.other_poll_running: %1$sThere seems to be another poll running here...
poll.no_reaction_perms: %1$sSeems like I cannot add reactions here...
poll.too_long: This was too long to show, so I pasted it: %1$s
poll.success:
**Poll started. React to the number to vote.**
*%1$s*
Type &cancelpoll to cancel a running poll.
poll.error: %1$sAn unknown error has occurred while setting up a poll. Maybe try again? (internal error)
poll.result_screen: **Showing results for the poll started by %1$s** with name: *%2$s*
poll.incorrect_time_format: %1$sIncorrect time format. Remember, the proper time format it's a number followed by `h, m or s` (hours, minutes or seconds). Example: `-time 40m`

timezone.success: %1$sSaved timezone, your profile timezone is now: **%2$s**

description.no_argument:

For example, ~>profile description set Hi there!

Check your shiny new profile with `~>profile`

lang.invalid: %1$sThat language doesn't exist! You can use `reset` to reset your language settings.

equip.no_content: %1$sYou have to specify which item to equip!

display.ls:
%1$sList of profile components:
%2$s **Widgets in Default Order:** `%3$s`
%2$s **Your widgets:** `%4$s`
You can use `~>profile widgets reset` to reset your profile display references

Example: `~>profile widgets header, credits, reputation, birthday, marriage, badges`
*Any order works, the order here is the order that will make them appear in your profile*

claimlock.success: %1$sYou can't be waifu claimed anymore. This used up a claim key.
claimlock.no_key: %1$sYou don't have a claim key to do this.

badges.donate_notice: **You can get a badge for [supporting the development of Mantaro!](https://patreon.com/mantaro)!** (It might take some minutes to process)
badges.footer: Badges are like achievements, and they're gained through progression in Mantaro's game or by just using the bot.

%2$s

birthday.no_guild_month_birthdays:

%3$sIf you just setup the birthday announcer, please wait a bit until running this again. (Cache refreshes every 23h)

birthday.invalid_date:
%1$sNot a valid date or it's not in the correct format.

%1$s%2$s is either not a valid date or I can't parse it properly. Please try with the correct formatting. Remember to include the year, although you can put any year and it won't affect anything.
Remember that the date format is `dd/mm/yyyy`

remindme.nothing_specified: %1$sWhat could I remind you of if you don't give me what to remind you? Oh! Lemme remind you of setting a reminder!

petactions.general:
Pets are your companion on the usage of currency! **You can train them, pet them, feed them or have fights between your own pets or pets from other people!** To create a pet you need an incubator, which you can cast from milk, old beverage and diamonds, this will allow you to incubate a pet, which will require you to give it a name.

Pets can fight in PetBattle, which is a turn-based (ish) fight system based in a one-turn strategy, with an emergency turn on the half-turn if the HP difference between the pets is too different, which would allow you to change your strategy.

For competition, you need to use different skills, which will cater to different elements and types. You chose them at the start of your turn or half-turn.
Skills are the main weapon you have! But, pets can also have a main weapon equipped, based on their type and affection. The weapon shop is available at `~>petaction shop` and you can equip it using `~>petaction weapon`, weapons *do not* have damage multiplier by themselves, but they can improve the effectiveness of some attacks and skills, as the result of this, there are no melee weapons, as all damage on PetBattle is done based on their will, not on their actual life.

Do `~>help petaction` to get a list of the commands you can use with your pet.

incubate.success: %1$sSuccessfully incubated your pet egg! Your new pet %2$s `(ID: %3$s)` is now ready. Check `~>pet <name>` to check pet stats.

birthday_enable.no_args: %1$sYou need to specify the channel name and the role name.
birthday_enable.public_role: %1$sYou cannot set the everyone role as a birthday role! Remember that the birthday role is a role that gets assigned to the person when the birthday comes, and then removes when the day passes away.
birthday_enable.autorole: %1$sYou cannot set the autorole role as a birthday role! Remember that the birthday role is a role that gets assigned to the person when the birthday comes, and then removes when the day passes away.
birthday_enable.warning: %1$sRemember that the birthday role is a role that gets assigned to the person when the birthday comes, and then removes when the day passes away.If you have any doubts on how to configure it, you can always join our support guild and ask. You can also check `~>opts help birthday enable` for an example.
birthday_enable.warning_1: This is because of how the birthday assigner works: It assigns a temporary role to the person having its birthday, and un-assigns it when the birthday day has passed. **This means that everyone with the birthday role will get the role removed the day the birthday passes through**. Please take caution when choosing what role to use, as a misconfiguration might make bad things happen (really)!
birthday_enable.warning_2: The role *has to be a newly created role or a role you don't use for anyone else*. It MUST NOT be a role you already have on your users.
birthday_enable.warning_3: Additionally the birthday cache (what is used to store them) is only updated every 23 hours. Meaning if you set your birthday today to tomorrow to test this announcer it will **not** work.
birthday_enable.warning_4: Type **yes** if you agree to set the role %2$s as a birthday role, and **no** to cancel. This timeouts in 45 seconds.
birthday_enable.success: %1$sBirthday logging enabled on this server with parameters -> Channel: `%2$s (%3$s)` and role: `%4$s (%5$s)`
birthday_enable.error_channel_1: %1$sI didn't find a channel or role!
birthday_enable.error_channel_2: *Remember, you don't have to mention neither the role or the channel, rather just type its name, order is <channel> <role>, without the leading "<>".* If the role contains spaces "wrap it in quotes like this"

birthday_disable.success: %1$sBirthday logging has been disabled on this server
